module_restrictions:
Your 'host' department during your exchange will be the academic
department that offers the academic programme you are admitted to. 50%
(or more) of your enrolled subjects must come from the host department.
Being attached to a host department will give you priority in registering for
subjects within that department. The other 50% (or less) workload can be
subjects offered by other departments.  
All registrations are subject to the approval of the respective departments.  
For more information, please refer to  
https://www.polyu.edu.hk/geo/exchange-and-study-abroad/incoming-
students/incoming-exchange/ > Programme Information > 3. Choose your
Host Department
visa_info:
Global Engagement Office (GEO) will act as your visa sponsor and send all the
required documents to the Hong Kong Immigration Department on your
behalf. Please upload a legible scan copy of the visa application form and the
relevant documents to the online application portal. Subsequent to the
uploading, students are required to send the original documents to GEO by
 post.
It usually takes 4 - 6 weeks to process a visa application. When the visa is
issued, we will collect it and send it to the address as indicated on your
online Application. Please inform GEO immediately if you have changed
your address.
accommodations_info:
Exchange students are guaranteed accommodation at the University-
managed Accommodation (including the Student Halls and Off-campus
 Housing) for a twin-sharing room, no single room is available.
Application instructions will be sent to successful applicants in the admission
 email. Application period is usually in early August and early December.
Details can be found at https://www.polyu.edu.hk/sao/student-resources-
and-support-section/residential-life/
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses in Hong Kong are as follows:

- Accommodation: HK$1,600
- Food: HK$3,000
- Transport: HK$300
- Others (Entertainment, clothes, books, electricity etc): HK$1,100

The monthly estimate of total living expenses is HK$6,000.
